page.title: 05Clifton Junior School
page.content: When the Primary School opened in September 1930 it was almost surrounded by pasture land and many of the original 35 children came from nearby farms.The school had 6 classrooms and numbers of pupils rapidly increased so that 3 new brick classrooms were built in 1937 and between 1947 and 1966 8 prefabricated classrooms were built. It was planned that they would be used for three years. They are still in use! The numbers increased to about 600 children as new housing estates were built in the neighbourhood after the war. In 1979 the infant department was closed and numbers have dropped to a total of 228 in 1985. Numbers are bound to be affected by new housing. Possibly a new junior school will be within the Clifton area.
